The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."

coloradosun.com

Colorado’s hair discrimination law — the CROWN Act — goes into effect

The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."

item.title: Diana is a solid member of the BLM5280 community and they have...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Diana is a solid member of the BLM5280 community and they have decided to help raise funds along with helping her apply for assistance. Diana is also an appreciated member of the QTPoC community in Denver Metro Area. (She has documented our beautiful community and always supported the local drag performers).
We are taking into account the history of medical racism and homophobia in our community, we are incredibly resilient! Diana is one of the most resilient people we know, seriously... she's been through her fair share of hospitalizations. Her body is working hard to go into remission and to be safe at home while she recovers from a successful bone marrow transplant. Anything you can give toward meeting her goal would be greatly appreciated! #doitforDiana

https://www.gofundme.com/f/qwoc-help-diana-beat-cancer…

HELP LOCAL QWOC RECOVER! ☺ If you have Venmo send funds directly to her @ Diana_Guardad… R Araceli Torres needs your support for Help Diana QWOC Beat Cancer

gofundme.com

Help Diana QWOC Beat Cancer, organized by R Araceli Torres

item.title: These atrocities our immigrant siblings are facing are...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

These atrocities our immigrant siblings are facing are unconscionable. We are physically ill over this latest revelation. Detention centers ARE concentration camps. Words have meaning, and we need to normalize calling them what they are. This article reminds us that with fascism things are always far worse than they seem. If the phrase ‘US concentration camps’ doesn't sit right with you support Abolish ICE Denver even harder. This is yet another affront to all of our humanity, and the Immigrant Community needs all of us now more than ever. #FreeThemAll #AbolishIce

CW: internal genital mutilation, eugenics, genocide

https://www.google.com/…/u-s-concentration-camp-sent-u…/amp/

Why are the terms “Nazi Germany” and “Mengele” become trending topics on Twitter? The words dominated the social media platform on Monday after it was revealed that a whistleblower has alleged “high numbers” of immigrant women at a U.S. concentration camp in Georgia were sent to be given...

item.title: Parasol Patrol is honored to be supporting the student created...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Parasol Patrol is honored to be supporting the student created and led "Youth Unite for Black Lives" at the Orchard Town Center 14697 Delaware Street, Westminster, CO 80023.

"I was informed that the youth of Adams 12 School
District are being bullied for standing up for black youth, black lives and against racism. C4RJ will be supporting this peaceful movement with a Youth led Rally followed by a March... Please park around 144th & Orchard Pkwy. Up, Up, Up for Black Lives Ada...ms County..." - Caravan for Racial Justice

We need volunteers to help at our sign making/info booth as well as participating with the event.

Please come and stand between potential protesters and these courageous young people.

So grab your umbrellas and if you happen to have extra sign making materials, water, ice, snacks,

This is a non-violent event.
We strongly encourage COVID-19 precautions such as masks, hand sanitizer and social distancing when possible.

So grab your umbrellas, Patrollers! And if you happen to have extra ice, snacks, first aid supplies, etc. Please dress appropriately for the weayher. Understandably, emotions run high here. Remember that we don't engage with protesters even when we feel strongly to do so.

We will be hosting a table with sign making materials, water, snacks, masks, first aid,... We're walking with the March and might drive one of the trucks in the back with water and first aid availablr from the bed of the truck. Tighten your laces and hoist your umbrellas. We'll see you there.
#LoveWins

See More

SUN, SEP 13

Parasol Patrol Supports Youth Unite For Black Lives

The Orchard Town Center

· WestminsterCauses · 132 people

item.title: Support a #blackownedbusiness and #ElijahMcClain’s family at...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Support a #blackownedbusiness and #ElijahMcClain’s family at the same time! 🖤🖤🖤

+3Konjo Ethiopian Food is at Konjo Ethiopian Food. · Denver

Justice for Elijah McClain✊🏾

100% of Sales from these Ethiopian themed masks will go directly to Elijah McClain's Family.

We cannot fathom what his mother has... had to endure, but it is our duty to do our part in the fight for social justice.

With the help of our Ethiopian adoptive families, who donated their time and resources to make these masks, we offer this small token of our solidarity.

Head over to our website and click the shop tab. They are also available at the restaurant.

www.konjoethiopianfood.com

Elijah McClain was a 23-year-old Black man who died last summer after the police in Aurora, Colo., restrained him with a choke-hold that has since been banned.

Mr. McClain was walking home from a convenience store on Aug. 24, 2019, when someone called 911, saying he “looked sketchy” and was wearing a ski mask and waving his arms.

The police arrived, and after struggling to handcuff Mr. McClain, officers brought him to the ground and used a carotid hold, which restricts blood to the brain to render someone unconscious. When medical responders arrived, after about 15 minutes, paramedics injected him with ketamine, a powerful sedative.

Mr. McClain went into cardiac arrest on the way to a hospital. He died a few days later.

We know this story far too well. Enough is Enough.

#InSolidarity #BlackLivesMatter #BLM #JustStopIt #EnoughIsEnough #ElijahMcClain #Aurora #Colorado #FightTheGoodFight #KonjoEthiopianFood #OneLove

Leah Newcomer Oliver
Kristi Griffith
Deirdre Shelvin Bell
Lisa Sevcik

See More

item.title: On #SexWorkerPrideDay this Sunday, September 13th we celebrate....
item.content:encoded:
On #SexWorkerPrideDay this Sunday, September 13th we celebrate.
We celebrate sex workers’ self-determination.
We celebrate sex workers’ enhanced visibility.
We celebrate the achievements of sex worker led organizations.
We celebrate and we keep the fight for decriminalization going until it is won.
#Sexworkiswork#decriminalizesexwork

item.title: #CallToAction...
item.content:encoded:
#CallToAction
HAPPENING NOW: Your mayor and council members are meeting to discuss the 2-year contract with #DenverPoliceDepartment that increases their budget in the second year. This budget increase allows for MORE funds devoted to the chemical weapons they terrorize our city with! They plan to quietly vote on it tomorrow 9/3 with only online public comment that they can control the narrative on with the click of a button. Contact your council member and Michael B. Hancock TODAY and let them know as their constituent you DEMAND they do not support the following:

❌Any Collective Bargaining Agreement with DPD longer than 1 year.

❌Any agreement that gives ANY financial increases or incentives to police.

❌Any agreement that does not require police to be financially responsible for their attorneys and settlements in any cases of alleged excessive force or race related discrimination

#DEFUNDPOLICE #DEFENDBLACKLIFE
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching...
item.content:encoded: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching and reading about any violence enacted on our friends and loved ones, pieces of ourselves, on the internet. We give thanks to the ancestors and higher power that guided #JacobBlake back to share more joyful moments with his children like the one in this picture we are intentionally sharing instead of that horrific video. Today we are reminded that it is an essential component of #Blackliberation to take pause and hold space for our whole selves —body, mind, and spirit. To choose healing. #Blackhealingisrevolutionary #BlackLivesMatter
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what...
item.content:encoded:
From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what we celebrate today as #BlackAugust. Black August, first commemorated by our incarcerated brothers and sisters, is a time to recommit ourselves to the struggle for #BlackLiberation and to honor those who’ve contributed to our collective progress and all those who have been lost to unjust violence and systemic racism.
This August 21, join us in a car protest to bring the Black August fight to our local prison walls. We will drive in a mobile protest to the Denver County Jail and the GEO Aurora ICE detention facility to let those who are chained there know that we are with them, we are fighting for them, and we will keep fighting until all chains are broken.
The many injustices faced by those behind bars in the U.S. are today amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prisons and jails all across the country, where medical neglect is commonplace and quarantining impossible, have become hotspots of infection. Hundreds have died in US prisons from COVID-19, and yet no response has been made to defend against unnecessary death. The mass incarceration of Black, Brown, and Indigenous populations means that they are not only disproportionately affected by the virus outside of jail, but inside as well.
We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:
1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.
2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.
3. Free all political prisoners!
#FreeThemAll #DecarcerateNOW #decarcerateCOVID19
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
